squares

Class Train

  • java.lang.Object
    • squares.Square
      • squares.CanOwn
        • squares.Train
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Printable

    public class Train
extends CanOwn
implements Printable
    The class that describes a Train Station object. This class file contains the method buy() which implements the abstract method from CanOwn class
    Author:
    Robert Keenan and Ciaran Nolan

    • Method Detail

      • buy

        public void buy(Player player,
                java.io.BufferedReader userInput)
        This is the buy method for a train station which takes the argument of a player to buy the train station. It checks whether you have funds to purchase it, if you don't it goes to auction. It then checks if the property is already owned. And then checks if you can purchase it, deducts the price from the player object's money and adds the purchased title deed card. If none of these cases are satisfied, it goes to auction.
        Specified by:
        buy in class CanOwn
        Parameters:
        player - The player object that wants to buy the train station
        userInput - BufferedReader used for simulating user input for much more complex tests in JUnit

      • printInstanceData

        public void printInstanceData()
        Printing the Instance data using Interface Printable
        Specified by:
        printInstanceData in interface Printable

      • canBuy

        public boolean canBuy()
        Whether you can buy the Square
        Specified by:
        canBuy in interface Printable
        Returns:
        true if no owner, false if there is an owner
